title: Avoiding Surge Pricing
vulnerability_information:
Please have a look at the video in this [video link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5uOIs56rbZkeDlxRG9TVDdKWkU/view?usp=sharing) which shows the bug and helps you reproduce the same following the steps. 

As you can see, there is surge of 1.3x in that area. But with this bug, one can avoid the surge. 

To explain the video in brief
First I selected Uber Go with the pickup location as "Prestige Shantiniketan" and destination as "Big Brewsky". Now the **"Share your car" fare is 249.91** and **"Get your own car" fare is 277.68.**
Now I go back to the map screen, and I scroll to the area which has no surge. And then I click on "set pickup location". 
In the confirmation screen, I change the pickup location to "Prestige Shantiniketan" (the location with surge) and use the same Destination "Big Brewsky". Ta-Da !! Now you can see the price without surge even though there is surge in that area (you can see surge symbol on "Request Pool" button). The **"Share your car" fare is 191.48** and **"Get your own car" fare is 212.76**. 
Since the UberPool fare is pre-decided, if one has booked using this bug will end up paying the non-surge price for UberPool.

PS: I've personally tried this loophole once for "Share your car" in the UberGo screen and it worked for me. 
This bug might even work for "Get you own car" or UberX, where the bill generated is considering non-surge price, but I haven't tried it. Although in the fare estimate, it shows the non-surge price in surge areas using the above trick.
vulnerability_information_html:
Please have a look at the video in this video link which shows the bug and helps you reproduce the same following the steps.

As you can see, there is surge of 1.3x in that area. But with this bug, one can avoid the surge.

To explain the video in brief
First I selected Uber Go with the pickup location as "Prestige Shantiniketan" and destination as "Big Brewsky". Now the "Share your car" fare is 249.91 and "Get your own car" fare is 277.68.
Now I go back to the map screen, and I scroll to the area which has no surge. And then I click on "set pickup location".
In the confirmation screen, I change the pickup location to "Prestige Shantiniketan" (the location with surge) and use the same Destination "Big Brewsky". Ta-Da !! Now you can see the price without surge even though there is surge in that area (you can see surge symbol on "Request Pool" button). The "Share your car" fare is 191.48 and "Get your own car" fare is 212.76.
Since the UberPool fare is pre-decided, if one has booked using this bug will end up paying the non-surge price for UberPool.

PS: I've personally tried this loophole once for "Share your car" in the UberGo screen and it worked for me.
This bug might even work for "Get you own car" or UberX, where the bill generated is considering non-surge price, but I haven't tried it. Although in the fare estimate, it shows the non-surge price in surge areas using the above trick.

activities.message:
Hey @nikhil_patil,

Thanks for the report!

As you can imagine, we've been flooded with reports since taking our bug bounty program live yesterday. I plan to validate this issue tomorrow AM, but please be patient with us during this process.

Cheers,
Rob

activities.message:
It has been partially fixed. I just verified and only the case 1 bug is fixed. And one more bug (case 2) still remains.
1. If I initially set my pickup location in *"No-Surge"* area and then in the confirmation screen, if I change the pickup location to *"Surge"* area, then the toast message "Fare has expired. Please try again" will be displayed and if I select *Request Uber*, the **Surge price will be applied**, which is as expected.
2.  But If I initially set my pickup location in *"Surge"* area and then in the confirmation screen, if I change the pickup location to *"No-Surge"* area, then **even though there is no surge in the latter pickup location**, if I select *Request Uber*, again the **Surge price is being applied**.

Should I raise a separate bug report for this second issue ?
activities.markdown_message:
It has been partially fixed. I just verified and only the case 1 bug is fixed. And one more bug (case 2) still remains.

  1. If I initially set my pickup location in "No-Surge" area and then in the confirmation screen, if I change the pickup location to "Surge" area, then the toast message "Fare has expired. Please try again" will be displayed and if I select Request Uber, the Surge price will be applied, which is as expected.
  2. But If I initially set my pickup location in "Surge" area and then in the confirmation screen, if I change the pickup location to "No-Surge" area, then even though there is no surge in the latter pickup location, if I select Request Uber, again the Surge price is being applied.

Should I raise a separate bug report for this second issue ?

activities.message:
Hey @nikhil_patil,

Awesome, glad to hear surge bypass is fixed!

No need to file another bug for #2 - I'll follow-up with the team, but this doesn't present any significant security/monetary impact so marking this resolved.

We plan to do a batch of bounty payouts within the next few weeks and you will receive a notification from HackerOne once we do that.

Thanks again for the report and good luck bug hunting in the future!

Cheers,
Rob
